alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 9:31AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding at the low water crossings on Highways U and C on Flat Creek from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain had fallen in the headwaters of Flat Creek. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway U and Flat Creek at Highway C. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jenkins and Mcdowell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
